snippet: The long-simmering dispute over some uninhabited islands prompted both sides to send out fighter jets, increasing risks of a mistake that could lead to armed conflict.
abstract: Long-simmering dispute between Japan and China over some uninhabited islands in East China Sea prompt both sides to send out fighter jets, increasing risks of mistake that could lead to armed conflict.

byline.contributor: Martin Fackler contributed reporting from Tokyo. Bree Feng contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The long-simmering dispute over some uninhabited islands prompted both sides to send out fighter jets, increasing risks of a mistake that could lead to armed conflict.

headline.seo: China-Japan Island Dispute Escalates to Air
headline.main: As Dispute Over Islands Escalates, Japan and China Send Fighter Jets to the Scene
headline.print_headline: As Dispute Over Islands Escalates, Japan and China Send Fighter Jets to the Scene
